title: Top 5 smartphones with 4GB RAM priced under Rs 15,000
text:
Top 5 smartphones with 4GB RAM priced under Rs 15,000 Top 5 smartphones with 4GB RAM priced under Rs 15,000 By February 21, 2017 “Multitasking should be a breeze with these budget powerhouses” 
Who would have imagined a year ago that smartphones priced under Rs 15,000 could offer as much as 4 gigs of RAM? But now when we look at the options, we find not one, not two, but quite a few devices achieving this feat, without burning a hole through your pocket. So without further ado, let’s take a look at some of the top smartphones that ship with 4GB of RAM, all priced under Rs 15,000. Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 (Rs 12,999) 
The latest budget blockbuster from Xiaomi brings a few improvements over its highly-acclaimed predecessor. The new phone is a metal-clad 5.5-incher that boasts a Snapdragon 625 SoC, complete with MIUI 8 with Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow. Along with these improvements comes an option to opt for a variant that comes with 4 gigs of RAM and 64GB of storage. Now this is what makes the deal even sweeter. Not to mention the device also scores big points when it comes to battery life. Coolpad Cool1 Dual (Rs 13,999) 
What do you get when two Chinese giants join hands to design a smartphone? Yes, it’s the Coolpad Cool1 Dual. Coming from LeEco and Coolpad, the smartphone makes use of a Snapdragon 652 SoC to keep things running. There’s an ample 4GB of RAM to enhance multitasking, while the dual rear cameras keep the shutterbugs busy. If you’re one for media consumption, you’d appreciate the crisp 5.5-inch full HD IPS LCD display on-board. Lenovo K6 Power (Rs 10,999) 
Enough with these big phablets. If you’re looking for a 5-incher with 4GB of RAM, then the K6 Power from Lenovo might be a perfect choice for you. Under the hood, it packs in a Snapdragon 430 processor, aided by an Adreno 505 GPU and 4 gigs of RAM. The K6 Power sources power from a 4,000mAh non-removable battery, meaning battery life shouldn’t be a problem. Features like a fingerprint scanner and Dolby Atmos sound also make this phone worth looking out for. vivo V3 Max (Rs 13,994) Even after about nine months since its launch, the V3 Max from vivo holds its ground against some of its newer counterparts. Beneath the 5.5-inch full HD display resides an octa-core Snapdragon 652 SoC, coupled with 4GB of RAM and 32GB of expandable storage. The optics department is taken care of by a 13MP / 8MP camera combo on the rear and front respectively. Moreover, the V3 Max comes with other features like a metal unibody design and a fingerprint scanner. Coolpad Note 5 (Rs 10,999) 
The Note range has been one of the most popular in Coolpad’s portfolio, and the Coolpad Note 5 tries to take that legacy forward. Talking about specs, the device comes powered by a Snapdragon 617 processor, 4GB of RAM and a respectable 4,010mAh battery which thankfully comes with quick charging support. Much like most of the smartphones in its range, the Note 5 also features a 5.5-inch full HD display. Above all that, it can be a delight for selfie enthusiasts, owing to the inclusion of a front flash to aid the 8MP front snapper. 
Related read: Coolpad Note 5 first impressions Worthy Mentions 
Setting a limit of Rs 15,000 meant we would be missing out on some capable contenders, just because they stretch the budget a little. And in case you can take that liberty, here are two devices that you must look before making your final decision. 
The first smartphone here is the Lenovo Z2 Plus ( review ), whose 4GB RAM variant is currently selling at Rs 17,499 on Amazon India. The Z2 Plus is the cheapest Snapdragon 820 device you can get your hands on right now, and thanks to that it is no slouch when it comes to performance. With a compact 5-inch full HD display, snappy performance, and a 3,500mAh battery that supports Quick Charge 3.0, the Z2 Plus is a promising device indeed. 
Next up is the recently launched Honor 6X ( review ), which costs Rs 15,999 for the 4GB RAM variant. The highlight of the smartphone is its dual rear facing cameras, while the performance department is taken care of by a HiSilicon Kirin 655 processor. 
So what is your pick? Did you imagine seeing smartphones with 4GB of RAM in this price segment one year ago? That’s how fast the world of technology advances.
